1.text: Does not wisdom call out, and understanding raise her voice?

2.text: On the heights overlooking the road, at the crossroads she takes her stand.

3.text: Beside the gates to the city, at the entrances she cries out:

4.text: “To you, O men, I call out, and my cry is to the sons of men.

5.text: O simple ones, learn to be shrewd; O fools, gain understanding.

6.text: Listen, for I speak of noble things, and the opening of my lips will reveal right.

7.text: For my mouth will speak the truth, and wickedness is detestable to my lips.

8.text: All the words of my mouth are righteous; none are crooked or perverse.

9.text: They are all plain to the discerning, and upright to those who find knowledge.

10.text: Receive my instruction instead of silver, and knowledge rather than pure gold.

11.text: For wisdom is more precious than rubies, and nothing you desire compares with her.

12.text: I, wisdom, dwell together with prudence, and I find knowledge and discretion.

13.text: To fear the LORD is to hate evil; I hate arrogant pride, evil conduct, and perverse speech.

14.text: Counsel and sound judgment are mine; I have insight and strength.

15.text: By me kings reign, and rulers enact just laws;

16.text: By me princes rule, and all nobles who govern justly.

17.text: I love those who love me, and those who seek me early shall find me.

18.text: With me are riches and honor, enduring wealth and righteousness.

19.text: My fruit is better than gold, pure gold, and my harvest surpasses choice silver.

20.text: I walk in the way of righteousness, along the paths of justice,

21.text: bestowing wealth on those who love me and making their treasuries full.

22.text: The LORD created me as His first course, before His works of old.

23.text: From everlasting I was established, from the beginning, before the earth began.

24.text: When there were no watery depths, I was brought forth, when no springs were overflowing with water.

25.text: Before the mountains were settled, before the hills, I was brought forth,

26.text: before He made the land or fields, or any of the dust of the earth.

27.text: I was there when He established the heavens, when He inscribed a circle on the face of the deep,

28.text: when He established the clouds above, when the fountains of the deep gushed forth,

29.text: when He set a boundary for the sea, so that the waters would not surpass His command, when He marked out the foundations of the earth.

30.text: Then I was a skilled craftsman at His side, and His delight day by day, rejoicing always in His presence.

31.text: I was rejoicing in His whole world, delighting together in the sons of men.

32.text: Now therefore, my sons, listen to me, for blessed are those who keep my ways.

33.text: Listen to instruction and be wise; do not ignore it.

34.text: Blessed is the man who listens to me, watching daily at my doors, waiting at the posts of my doorway.

35.text: For whoever finds me finds life and obtains the favor of the LORD.

36.text: But he who fails to find me harms himself; all who hate me love death.”
